intro: Meriania glabra var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved meriania, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melastomataceae, characterized by its showy, often violet or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, featuring opposite, elliptic leaves that are often glabrous or nearly so. Its flowers are usually clustered in cymes and are known for their ornamental value in horticulture. The species is adapted to humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
